channel.title: Jaffa's musical experiments w. Axoloti
channel.description:
Hey!
Here is a piece of music I made. Could be much better organised, but it is a start. First generative/algortihmic track. I used 2 Axolotis for this and some custom wavetable etc.
Anyway here goes the Axoloti track: https://soundcloud.com/jaffasplaffa/smr-final-1-master-1
This second one is released on a american record label called Drop Out Productions, and is not made with Axoloti, just thoughtI'd share it as a bonus ;): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZoN5Hm1m6u8
Merry christmas to everyone in Axoloti world ;)

item.title: Jaffa's musical experiments w. Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Since it is so poluar these days to post short clips of what you are doing here is another short one from me. 100% Axoloti, recorded with my Iphone 4S's microphone. No post processing;

Read full topic

item.title: Jaffa's musical experiments w. Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Blindsmyth:

Arrangement wise I feel there could be more variation, changes in note density, timbre, elements popping in and out so that the arrangement gets a bit more dynamic.

Thanks for the feedback

Yes I totally agree with you that it needs to be arranged better. Anyway, first version recorded, I'll probably record another version in the near future. Maybe also add a third Axoloti for some extra variation Need to get another USB to test for that to become reality first.

Read full topic

item.title: Jaffa's musical experiments w. Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

nice, like the vibe reminds me a little bit of Aphex Twin.

Arrangement wise I feel there could be more variation, changes in note density, timbre, elements popping in and out so that the arrangement gets a bit more dynamic.

Read full topic
